alert.note: Alert for Carbon (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 12 at 10:42AM MDT until June 15 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Montana... Clarks Fork Of The Yellowstone at Edgar affecting Carbon County. Clarks Fork Of The Yellowstone near Belfry affecting Carbon County. .Heavy rain will fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. For the Clarks Fork Of The Yellowstone...including Belfry, Edgar... Minor flooding is forecast. * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Clarks Fork Of The Yellowstone near Belfry. * WHEN...Until early Wednesday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM MDT Sunday the stage was 9.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM MDT Sunday was 9.6 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall to 9.1 feet this evening. It will then rise to 11.2 feet early tomorrow afternoon. It will fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning to 5.9 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.0 feet on 06/09/1981. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Mon Tue Wed Clarks Fork Of The Yellowstone Belfry 9.0 9.6 Sun 10 am 9.0 7.4 5.9 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: https://water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 1045 AM MDT.
